intro: Henryettana mirabilis, commonly known as the marvelous henryettana, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from yellow to orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Henryettana mirabilis is considered a vulnerable species.
